===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|まさ|ゆめ}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=まさゆめ|正|tr1=masa|t1=true, proper, certain|夢|tr2=yume|t2=dream}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref><ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|まさゆめ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|まさゆめ}}

# a [[dream]] that [[come true|comes true]], a [[veridical]] dream
# a [[dream]] that [[seem]]s [[real]], a [[realistic]] dream

=====Antonyms=====
* {{sense|realistic dream}} {{ja-r|逆夢|さかゆめ}}: a dream that is the [[opposite]] of [[reality]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|せい|む}}
Possibly from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=せいむ}} compound {{m|zh|正夢|tr=tsyeng<sup>H</sup> mjuwng<sup>H</sup>|lit=right, proper, correct + dream}}.

Alternatively, may have been coined in Japan of {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived elements.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|せいむ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|せいむ}}

# a [[dream]] that [[come true|comes true]], a [[veridical]] dream
# a [[dream]] that [[seem]]s [[real]]

=====Usage notes=====
This reading is less common than the ''masayume'' reading above.
